title: Android VR Developer: Incompatibility between Google Cardboard Library and JNI.
content:
I bought a Pixel 3 around a month ago to use it as my testing device for my applications. I am working on VR/AR applications. I have been trying to use some libraries that are written in C++ together with the Google Cardboard Library. To do so, I have been using the JNI in Android Studio (The NDK is obsolete for this matter). However, when I run my application, it says that my device runs different ABIs that my application does not. Also every time that I tried to create a new project that includes native C++ as default and then include the Google VR library, the same error occurs again. 

I would like to know if the root cause of my problem is my phone or if it is Android and the Google VR library.
